explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning algorithms to identify malicious transactions in digital currencies.
explanations.deep learning: The proposed method, GraphSniffer, is based on deep learning techniques, specifically graph neural networks.
explanations.neural network: GraphSniffer utilizes neural networks to model graph-structured Bitcoin transaction data.
explanations.representation learning: The paper involves learning representations of transaction data to identify malicious activities.
explanations.graph neural network: The proposed model, GraphSniffer, is a graph neural network designed to handle graph-structured transaction data.
explanations.federated learning: The paper employs federated learning to protect the security of transaction feature data and model privacy by distributing the learning process across different worker nodes.
